page.title: 03ALLET METHODIST CHAPEL,TRURO
page.content: Allet has a small, well-kept, cream- painted Chapel beside the B3284 road near the hamlet.It is well- attended every Sunday by an active 50- strong congregation, mainly farmers & their families from a 5-mile radius; many of them are related, giving the Chapel a family feeling. The Family Service is at 11a.m. weekly; evening services are 6.15p.m.in winter, 6.45 in summer; the Sunday School has about 10 children. There are many young people in the congregation. The Minister is from Threemilestone Methodist Church; services are often conducted by local preachers from a wide area,or by Methodist Ministers of Truro circuit. Other Chapel activities are a Guild every Friday, well-attended by all ages,with speaker,games, refreshments; carol singing for National Children's Home;active support for Christian Aid.
